intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Good morning, Ike. May I have a moment of your time?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it? I’m listening.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Our expenses, our ability to fight...The current status of our troops...These are all things that you must know.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I see. Having a grasp of that is part of the commander’s job, too, right? Understood. Let me hear it.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Very well.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: And that’s it.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ugh...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike? Is something wrong?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Even though I was aware of the numbers, hearing it in a report like this is...hard.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Do you mean the casualites and refugees?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Death and destruction are all part of war. My father said that a lot. The first casualties of war are those without strength and those without luck. And there’s nothing you can do about it. Live with bravery, be daring and fearless. Live for those who have died. And yet...I can’t help but think f I were more powerful...I could save more people. Couldn’t I?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Blast!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Indeed.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Forgive me. I got carried away.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: No, not at all... Um, perhaps I should...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Thank you for the report. I will need more of the same from here on. Keep up the good work.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Thank you, Commander. I will do my best. But if I have your leave, I must be going.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...That’s it.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I think I’ve got most of it.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I’ll give you a report before each battle. I hope that it helps.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’m sure it will. Thank you. I’m relying on you for all the details. Keep up the good work.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: This place brings back such memories. It hasn’t changed in the slightest.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Titania, have you been to Gallia before?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: A long time ago...When I was still a knight of Crimea. I volunteered for a military officer exchange program and spent some time studying at Gallia’s royal palace.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I get it now...That’s why you weren’t surprised when we saw the laguz.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: That’s right. Ah, I’ve missed the sea. When the setting sun strikes the water, it’s almost as though the horizon itself is on fire.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hmm. Now that I think about it, my father knew where that old castle was...He sure acted like someone who’d been to Gallia before. Was he here with you?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Mm-hm. And we weren’t the only ones. You’ve been here, too, Ike.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Unknown
intro.line: Ike!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: It’s Mordecai. You’d better answer him.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yeah, but...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: We can finish our talk later, after we’ve reached the castle.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, that was cryptic.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it, Mordecai?

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Do you tire? Should we rest here?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: No, I think we’re all right.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Good.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: Beorc are such a weak species. A distance like this is nothing. Any laguz worth his claws could cross it in a single bound.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Lethe!

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: Hmph! It is the truth!

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: If you persist in this way, you will shame the king. You sound like a fool.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: Hsss! You are my subordinate! Never speak to me in such a way![

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: What’s wrong is wrong. You are a fierce warrior, Lethe, but when it comes to the beorc, you are far too stubborn.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: What did you say?!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Come on now, both of you...Let’s calm down.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: ...Mordecai?

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: ...Wait...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: That smell on the wind...It’s iron. The smell of beorc. Heavily armored. Well armed.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you sure?

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: General Kotaff! The Crimean mercenaries have entered our area of operations!

intro.speaker: Kotaff
intro.line: Ha! They’re trapped! Call every last man. Ready for battle! We stop the enemy here!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Black armor...They’re Daein men, all right.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You’re saying that some of the invasion force is still around?

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: Daein worms...They strut about the Gallian forests as though they own them. I won’t stand for it!

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Grrr...The castle to the south.Many beorc are inside. They carry iron weapons. I smell them.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Not good...Titania! Gather everyone together!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ha! Understood!

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: What now?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: If you hope to crush the worms, you’d do well to capture the ruins in the south. Since you probably want to flee, there is an escape route...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We’re going to fight.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: Oh?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: There are times when running has its advantages, but I don’t think we’ll lose here.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: ...I see.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: I will also fight.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Good. We could use the help.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ike! Everyone’s here!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right, let’s go!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I want you two to take Mist and Rolf and retreat to the rear.

intro.speaker: Jorge
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Daniel
intro.line: We’re counting on you. Be careful!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Everyone who can fight, grab a weapon! Greil Mercenaries...Move out!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Ike!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist! You and Rolf clear out of here! Stay back, no matter what!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: No, Ike! We’re going to fight with you–both of us.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What? No. That’s not going to happen. Be serious, Mist...The two of you can’t even wield weapons.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I’ve got this!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: A heal staff?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Yeah! I made Rhys teach me how to use it. I can heal injuries! I mean, just little ones, but still...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Little ones? No. There’s no way I’m letting you on this battlefield...Huh?

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Rolf! Stop being such a brat, you little twerp!

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: I’m going to fight, too! I’m good with a bow!

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Really? That’s news to me. Is that the best lie you could come up with?

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: It’s no lie!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: That’s right! He’s not lying.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Of course he is!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What are you talking about, Mist?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Rolf’s always practicing with his bow. And he’s really good! Aren’t you?!

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: I sure am!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: And when did you learn to use a bow?

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: Well, let’s see...Um...I guess I just...sorta...picked it up naturally?

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Stop lying, you booger-eating brat! You can’t just pick up a weapon and start firing away! Someone has to teach you the basics!

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: Well, maybe I’m just a prodigy, cause I learned it all myself!

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: You little...

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: You don’t know anything, Boyd!

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: That’s right!

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: This is ridiculous!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Enough. You two go back.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: No! We don’t want to! All Rolf and I do is sit and wait and worry about all of you. We’re tired of waiting! We want to fight by your side!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Is that so?

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: How about it, Rolf? Is that how you feel, too?

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: Uh-huh. No doubt, we’d rather be with you.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Sigh...

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: What now, Commander?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We take them with us. We’re too pressed for time to sit around here bickering. And at least if they’re nearby, they’ll be easier to protect.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Are you serious?!

intro.speaker: Rolf
intro.line: Yes! You won’t regret this, Ike! I promise!

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: I hope not.

battle.speaker: Marcia
battle.line: Let’s see now...Where are they? Aha! I’ve found them!

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: Yar har ho!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Yo ho har!

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: Scallywags of the sea are we!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: We fight like beasts, an’ men do flee!

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: We earn our gold with axes bold...Yar! Ye scurvy bilge rat! Why aren’t ya singin’?

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Har! Over there, Nedata! Fix yer eyes on that. Do ye sees what I sees?

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: Oh ho ho! What’s this, then? Humans battling humans here in Gallia? What in the briny beard of Shanty Pete is going on?

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Oy! Do ya think they may be the king’s curs out to capture us and claim the bounty?

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: Gahar har har!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Shall we unfurl the mainsail and steer for calmer waters?

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: Bite yer tongue, ye kelp-brained idjit! We’re pirates! We don’t turn tail from government scum! I’m goin’ ashore! Watch me, and you’ll see a true sea-dog in action.

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Yar, well said! You’ve set me blood aboil! I’m with ye all the way, matey!

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: Aarrr! Let’s see what we can see then!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Yar! Me axe is sharp, and me spirit is bold!

battle.speaker: Nedata
battle.line: Yar har ho!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Yo ho har!

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: By the way...

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: What is it?

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: If there is some special task you would ask of us, we are willing to listen.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: What are you talking about?

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: Bah! Open your ears! If you wish it, we shall...follow your orders. Hssss! But you must Direct us.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Really? You’re willing to take orders from me?

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: This is a beorc fight. If you don’t Direct us, then we have no reason for being here. So spoke our king.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: But last night, you...

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: THAT...That was an...emergency.

battle.speaker: Mordecai
battle.line: We thought you were in danger.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: You thought correctly. We were in danger. I thank you. We were greatly aided by your arrival.

battle.speaker: Mordecai
battle.line: You are welcome.

battle.speaker: Lethe
battle.line: Hmm.

battle.speaker: Mordecai
battle.line: Very well. Let us fight together. If you choose not to Direct us, we shall do as we please. Do you find this acceptable?

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Of course. Well then, good fortune to us all.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: That’s right. It’s me! Marcia! As promised, I’m here to pay my debt...I’m going to join your group!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Join us? But I thought you were one of the holy pegasus knights of Begnion...

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Pfff! I resigned So what do you say? Are you going to let me in or what? Come on!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Are you sure about this? I mean, I’ll be honest with you. We’re a destitute band of mercenaries. Your wages will be a pittance compared to what you’re used to.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: So, what? Are you saying no?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: No, I’m simply pointing out that you’ll be losing almost all of...

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Pfff! I won’t lose out on anything! Plus, I’ll work twice as hard as anyone else. C’mon, please let me join? PLEEEEASE!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Well, if that’s what you want, I guess we’ll give it a shot. We’re shorthanded though, so you’re going to be busy.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Huzzah! That’s great! Just tell me what needs doing!

battle-talk.speaker: Boyd
battle-talk.line: Hold a minute. That was too easy. What’s going on?

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: Nothing. But if I’m close to you, I can protect you. So you have no need to worry.

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: What? But...Aren’t you here to yell at me?

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Why? Did you do something to make me mad?

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: I thought maybe my whole decision to fight and stuff...I made that on my own. I thought that it might upset you.

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: I won’t complain about the commander’s decisions.

battle-talk.speaker: Rolf
battle-talk.line: So, you’re all right with it?

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: I suppose. But I want you to stay close, so I can watch out for you.

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Wait! There is one thing. When did you learn to use a bow?

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: That’s no answer. Rolf! Blast! I told you to stay close!

visit.speaker: Female Cat Laguz
visit.line: Urk! Urk! Ahhh...Oh, come on! You are so rude! If you can’t tell, I’m playing dead. So go away! Huh? Why? Because my mother told me, If you ever meet a beorc, play dead, and it will leave you be. It’s not true, is it? Hsss! I knew it wasn’t true! I knew it! Well then, take this, and get out of here! Quickly! I HATE humans! I don’t want to talk to you!Hsss! SHOO!!

visit.speaker: Cat Laguz
visit.line: You’re from Crimea, aren’t you? I’m a warrior of the beast tribe. Lord Ranulf spoke of you.  Doubtless you have noticed that Fort Tatana has been taken by Daein forces. Watch your step around that bunch. There’s a dangerous mage with them. We of the beast tribe find magic, and especially fire magic, particularly threatening. I am waiting for friends and cannot take leave of this house, but...I would give you this. If you use it, your magical resistance will increase. It will help you fight that mage. Take care.

boss.speaker: Nedata
boss.line: Scallywags of the sea are we! We earn our gold with axes bold!

boss.speaker: Nedata
boss.line: Scallywags of the sea...are we...An end like this is quite...worthy!

boss.speaker: Kotaff
boss.line: Death to the rogues who defy Daein! Defend our brethren! Erase their shame!

boss.speaker: Kotaff
boss.line: Arrgh...urr...urg...In the name...of the empire...Cleanse...my shame...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: We defeated their commander, but we still don’t know what they were after.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: It seems unlikely that they were merely pursuing Princess Elincia. I wonder if Daein is planning to invade Gallia. Perhaps Crimea was only a stone on which to whet their blades.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: No matter the motive, the fact remains that Daein crossed the border. Under such circumstances, hostilities between Daein and Gallia could break out at any time.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So, it’s war...Again.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: If war erupts between the beorc and laguz, it’s only a matter of time before other nations become involved. Could Daein truly mean to set the land aflame in a blaze of war? If that happens, many of our citizens will be sacrificed on the altar of their ambition.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: We, too, need to choose which way to move, whose side to take...

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Whose side? We shall never support Daein! Unthinkable!

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Captain Titania, we are human. Would you truly have us side with sub–with laguz against other humans? THAT is unthinkable.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Beorc and laguz...

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Are you going to sit here and argue about a war that hasn’t started? You beorc are all so timid! It’s pathetic.

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Lethe! You must not say such things.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mordecai? Lethe? What do you think? Will it come to war?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Our claws are sharp. If Daein invades Gallia, we are ready for battle. If our king wills it, war will come.

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: I like it not...War brings pain. Sorrow.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: This is troubling...

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Enough. We have lost much time. Let us make for the palace. We must reach tonight’s camp before the sun sets.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is the palace still far?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: On your skinny beorc legs, it is very far. But we will do as we can.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: My lord Ike! Everyone!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Princess Elincia.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I heard about...Commander Greil. I...I don’t know what to say.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Don’t worry. We’re all right. We’re getting by...somehow.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...Oh, Ike...

end.speaker: Cat Laguz
end.line: The king has arrived.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Um... Hey there.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Thank you for coming to Gallia Palace. I am Caineghis, ruler of the kingdom of Gallia.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: These are the Greil Mercenaries. I am Ike, their commander.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: You have been raised well, young pup. I didn’t recognize you.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: When last you were here, you were still a small child.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Is that you, Titania? It’s good to see you.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: The pleasure is all mine, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The two of you are friends? How...How does the king know me?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Mm. I have something I must tell you about your father, Greil...

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Lethe. Mordecai. Leave us now. Prepare rooms, so our guests may have a place to rest and heal their wounds.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: At once, my lord!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Would it be best if I were to leave as well?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: No, Princess. I would have you stay. And this one also will stay.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: This is Giffca, my shadow. Pay him no more heed than you would the air.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Understood. I would have Titania and Soren stay with me, as well.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Me?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: So be it. Now then, where to begin?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Titania? How much did Greil tell his son?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ike was raised with no knowledge of Gallia whatsoever, nor does he recall ever having been here.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Is that so? Then it is best for me to tell him all that I know. ...Although that is not much.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That’s all right. Whatever you can tell me would be much appreciated. I want to know more of my father.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Hmm...You have good eyes. Honest and brave.I see your father in them. Long ago, Greil...your father...worked as a mercenary for Gallia. We forged a strong bond, he and I. To speak truly, I still do not trust the beorc. But your father was different.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Princess Elincia’s father, King Ramon, and his brother, Lord Renning, are also of a different kind. All are...or were...exceptional men. Men in whom one could put his trust.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Oh ho! Titania! You are an exception as well! Among beorc females, you are unique.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: You are most gracious, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: My father was a mercenary for Gallia...?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Correct. And you and your sister? You were both born here in Gallia. You stayed only for a short time, but part of your childhood was spent within these borders.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mist and I were born here? Is that so? I don’t remember any of this at all.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: I feel your parents were carrying a dark secret. Someone was hunting them, I’m sure of it. Once, over ten years ago...and after your mother had been slain...Your father chose to leave Gallia. Before he left, I went to him and asked him to share his tale. I asked him, Why are you being chased? Is there anything I can do to help? But I was unable to loosen his tongue. And then I heard he had returned to Gallia, and I thought I had another chance to hear his tale. His fate was black indeed. If I had been faster, if I had hastened my steps, perhaps things would be different.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Wait! Now I understand. The voice I heard...That was you, wasn’t it?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: His wound was fatal. I could do nothing. I thought it best not to interfere in his final moments, so I remained hidden. Tell me, Ike... At his last, did he confess anything to you? The identity of the Black Knight...Did he reveal it?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The Black Knight? No. I don’t know who he was. My father entrusted me with his command, told me to trust King Caineghis and to live peacefully in Gallia. He said to forget everything else.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Is that so? Well then, let me do as I can. If any of your mercenaries desire to live here, I will so arrange it. I will vouchsafe them homes and land.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Your kindness is truly appreciated. But, speaking for myself, I couldn’t live here in peace. Not now. I will avenge my father. I cannot so quickly forget the past...Or the Black Knight.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: But, Ike! That’s not...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I know. I’m not...I’m not strong enough. An opponent who could defeat my father is well beyond my reach...But that’s why I’ve devoted myself to growing stronger. I will lead my father’s mercenaries and prepare for the day when my chance for revenge arrives.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: A prudent course of action. You look as one who would be more impulsive, but you are Greil’s son after all.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ha! You’ve matured, Ike. It seems like yesterday that you were merely a child.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Titania...

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: And now, I would ask a boon of you.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: The strength of your mecenary band, Ike, would you lend it to Princess Elincia?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Are you serious?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: King Caineghis!

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Gallia and Crimea are allied nations, that cannot be denied. However, this alliance in reality binds only the royal families. It is not respected by our citizenry.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: The people of Gallia are seldom seen in Crimea, are they? Even though our nations are friends, the people of Crimea have little real understanding of the laguz. Many of our people still use that undignified name, sub-human, when they speak of the laguz...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...My father’s heart was filled with shame and sorrow over what you describe. More than any king in our history, he wanted to deepen relations between our people, and then...

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Perhaps that is why Daein targeted him. Their hatred of the laguz is well known.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Could it be...?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: In my heart of hearts, I would like to take guardianship of Princess Elincia and assist in the rebuilding of Crimea. However, anti-beorc sentiment is running high here in Gallia. If we were to offer safe harbor to Elincia, I feel many of our elder statesmen would protest. They would say that we are giving Daein an ideal excuse to attack.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Which means Gallia can’t offer Princess Elincia any relief at all...Is that it?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Unfortunately, it is true.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: My lord Ike, King Caineghis has advised me to turn to the Begnion Theocracy for aid in Crimea’s restoration. He says we should make of Begnion a formal request and gain the support of their shields.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Passage to Begnion will require several months at sea. An escort will be necessary...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: As you know, we lack the numbers to serve as a complete mercenary army. So, if the princess were willing to hire us as an escort, it would be an offer beyond our expectations.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Titania! Soren! I think perhaps we should accept the king’s offer. What do you say?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: It’s what you want, right, Commander? Well then, it’s our job to follow you.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: However you wish to proceed is fine. I will do all in my power to ensure that our road leads to success.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Understood. As of now, the Greil Mercenaries shall assume the honor of serving as escort to the princess of Crimea.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Princess Elincia, our journey together will undoubtedly be a long one. May we serve you well.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh, thank you very much! I only pray that I, in turn, may be worthy of your service!
